metadata.title: CPIO: extraction allows symlinks which enables Remote Command Execution (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A path traversal vulnerability was found in the CPIO utility. This issue could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to trick a user into opening a specially crafted archive. During the extraction process, the archiver could follow symlinks outside of the intended directory, this allows writing files in arbitrary directories through symlinks. 
            STATEMENT: This vulnerability requires the attacker to use social engineering on the victim to get them to open the cpio archive.
            MITIGATION: Use the --no-absolute-filenames option to avoid this behaviour.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
cpio is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
